title: What is the future of humanity if we keep up what we are doing now? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not much different than in the past decades, centuries, millenia, IMO. But today we have more powerful tools that are accessible to an enormous number of people on earth….and this seems to be increasing. Of course the upside is an ability to (continue to) make impressive advancements for many of the people on earth….and some trickle down (less impressive but still very significant) benefits for many others, as well. But we should never forget that more powerful tools in the hands of more people also increases the probability of accidental and deliberate catastrophes. Some catastrophes are local (be they accidental or deliberate) but not all are local. Predatory opportunists will always exist….always. So if they have access to these ever increasing tools as well, global catastrophes are almost surely to result. I would not be at all surprised if someday we find that COVID-19 was part of some experimenting that was taking place and an accident (maybe deliberately, maybe not) occurred. I believe HIV release was similar with medical professionals in Africa involved in “the accident”. A disgruntled employee, a passionate activist or someone bypassing safety/handling procedures (to expedite a result, maybe or laziness or inattention) can rather easily “cause an accident” as well as true accidents that can occur (spills, machine failures, etc.). I don’t mean to scare anyone but IMO, the likelihood of these types of “powerful tech” unpleasant occurrences will be on the increase, not decrease. So it’s how these potentialities are regulated, monitored and handled that will likely determine how risky or safe our future as a species will be. Note the HIV initiated in Africa and COVID-19 in China….both are regions with less candor+openness in what is taking place, compared to more well monitored western areas. Most westerners would surely be shocked by what they would see if they were observing the location of and at the actual accident/release. Knowledge (and the tools to use it) cannot advance faster than Wisdom without these issues arising. Handing freedoms to children (or childish adults) who lack wisdom is a recipe for eventual disasters. I hope this helps.

What is the future of humanity if we keep up what we are doing now? I think it is bleak. We’ve built a society of greed and hate. We think nothing of hurting others in order to fulfill our every desire. Humankind doesn’t understand that we are violating the basic laws of nature—interdependence, altruism, balance, harmony, interconnection, unity. If we come into alignment with these principles, the world will change for the better.

Q: What is the future of humanity if we keep up what we are doing now? A: There are two paths. Either we succumb to climate change, fuelled by authoritarianism and short-sighted drive for profit. There will be lots of death and war and mass extinction, but possibly humanity survives in the remote corners of the Earth, and eventually rediscover cool stuff that their ancestors did.Or we do something about it, and we buy ourselves time to continue the trajectory we’re on towards a more peaceful and less dangerous civilisation.
